OneLineDescription: Removes Food Items from Creation Engine Games like Skyrim and Enderal
LongDescription:
Mutagen Patcher that iterates through all placed food objects in a cell and disables them based on defined criteria.

The idea is to remove excess food lying around (supposedly) deserted locations. The patch will locate every food item in a cell and then randomly decide if it should be removed or left in place. The chances that it will be removed is configurable in User Settings. By default the less a location is populated, the higher the chance food will be removed, so drauger dungeons will have a 100% chance of food removal (default), while farmhouses will have a lower 80% chance (default).

Most settings can be configured through the GUI (User Settings) including:
	Chance of Food Removal per Location Type
	List of Special Locations and Food Removal Chance
	Change Ownership of all remaining Food items to Cell Owner
	Locations to ignore
	Plugins to ignore

Rules for removal are very strict, so usually any possibly problematic food, like food that is enabled/disabled by scripts is left unchanged to avoid breaking any quests. But Creation Engine physics being what it is, sometimes you will encounter areas where food is visibly disturbed, usually because the bottom item of a stack has been removed.
